description: Support to the Electoral Process in Mozambique

subproject.corporate outcome: Legislatures, regional elected bodies, and local assemblies have strengthened institutional capacity, enabling them to represent their constituents more effectively
subproject.description:
To achieve sustainability and better quality of elections, Mozambique needs to address electoral challenges thoughout the electoral cycles. UNDP will support the Electoral Management Bodies to address this challenge by achieving the following outputs:
1- Capacities of CNE/STAE in election planning, budgeting, organisation and management in selected technical areas strengthened
2.  New forms and channels of civic and voter education implemented during the whole electoral cycle 2007-2009.
3 - Effective communication with the public maintained by CNE/STAE 
4- Members of political parties sensitized on good practices of elections and participatory governance
5- Voter education promoted to enhance the capacity to realize informed election results and to ensure full participation of voting population in the electoral process
6- Enhanced and accessible systems of public information and education that promote democratic governance through increased use of Media Centre
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Electoral Assistance II

subproject.title: Electoral Assistance II

subproject.corporate outcome: Legislatures, regional elected bodies, and local assemblies have strengthened institutional capacity, enabling them to represent their constituents more effectively
subproject.description:
The project's specific outputs are: 
a) Management capacity of Electoral Management Bodies strengthened
b) Media and Parliament  supported to play an effective role on electoral civic education
c) Improved participation of women and youth as voters, candidates and electoral staff

subproject.title: Electoral cycle support
